thread.title: Woman arrested for shooting man in Albany
thread.title_full: Woman arrested for shooting man in Albany

author: KGW Staff
title: Woman arrested for shooting man in Albany
text:
ALBANY, Ore. â€” A man remains in critical condition after allegedly being shot by his girlfriend Thursday, Albany Police Department said.
Around 2 a.m.,
Albany police responded to a call, saying his roommate had been shot by his girlfriend at a residence near 600 34th Avenue Southeast.
Officers found the man, Lucas Allen Forbes, 30, with a
[gunshot wound](/crime) to his head. Forbes was transported to the Good Samaritan Medical Center in Corvallis and remains in critical condition.
'SURVIVORS ARE WORKING SO HARD':
[ Domestic violence workers react to restraining order violation turned deadly police shooting](/article/news/local/domestic-violence-advocates-react-deadly-police-shooting-hillsboro/283-c7b45141-0d3d-4a16-b44e-55750e1c2cab)
His girlfriend, Hami Lee, was later taken into custody and charged with domestic violence, second-degree assault, menacing and unlawful use of a weapon.
This is a developing story and will be updated with more information as it becomes available.
If anyone is involved in a domestic violence situation or know of a situation involving domestic violence, call the National Domestic Violence Hotline at 800-799-7233 or the local law enforcement agency. The Center Against Rape and Domestic Violence (CARDVA) has a 24-hour crisis and support line and are local to Linn and Benton Counties.
